title: Thanksgiving "FIGHT KNIGHT"
body_text:
WALL vs. ALL 11: The Results
Personal rivalries, single-person showdowns, and bitter one-on-one animosity were violently kicked aside for
EastCoastDodgeball's
2010 Thanksgiving "Fight Knight." At the forefront of the action comprised two deadly alliances each seething with nearly 24 months of pent-up frustration - the homeland WALL Knights and the daring ALL Army.
In this unprecedented 11th encounter, which faction would miraculously walk away unconquered?
MATCH SUMMARY
Upon arrival at the hallowed Wall High School battlegrounds, it was evident the ALL invaders had come properly prepared with heavy human weaponry and several surprise reinforcements. The mere sight of their starting five-man opposition had most of them chuckling before the initial weapon was even hurled! But it was the only laugh any of which would experience.
The 11th WALL Army was perhaps as fierce and nasty as any previous coalition assembled. Lead by veterans Fitzpatrick, Letsche, Basista, and Adams, this 8-person fortress humiliated the outnumbering ALL squad six out of the first seven vicious battles.
Catching machine and
ECDElitist
Mike "Sputz", the quick and agile Tronolone Brothers, as well as newly-inducted
Elitist
"Crazy One" Edwards fought valiantly to alter the tide of this shocking outcome. Every ounce of sweat and energy was drained from their systems from the experienced veterans to the less familiar, yet fearless combatants like Tim Lawrence, Kenny Jacobs, and Arthur Casbarro.
By the conclusion of 11 physically-taxing contests, the massive 11th ALL Army - all 18 strong - were handily sent retreating, forced to fight another day.
Team WALL
defeated
Team ALL
, 8 - 3
.
The Yearbook
Team ALL's 11th Army may have been the most diverse of any previous combination put together. Numerous high schools were represented: Allentown
(DiBuccio)
, Estavam Ferri***
(Lima)
, Freehold Boro
(Pham)
, Manasquan
(Casbarro, Jacobs, Krott, Londono, Megill, Yochum)
, Monmouth Regional
(Lawrence, J. Tronolone, M. Tronolone, Winston)
, Notre Dame*
(Gore)
, Ocean Township
(Edwards)
, Pennington
(D'Luhy)
, Shore Regional
(Moran)
, and West Springfield**
(Hoppe)
*New school representation (Lawrenceville, New Jersey).
**Out-of-state representation (West Springfield, Virginia).
***First out-of-country school represented (Sao Jose, Sao Paulo, Brazil)
Online Exclusive!
WALL vs. ALL 11
became the second Wall-All clash to be held on Thanksgiving weekend, the first of which held in
2007
.
On September 11, 2010,
ECD
fanatics witnessed the ribbon-cutting ceremony of the
ECDElite
Hall of Fame. That night, seven of the game's finest were respectfully honored in front of countless friends, family, and peers. Some three months later, the
ECDElite
halls reopened its doors to induct two more iconic figures, and they are - - -
Michael Edwards
Born March 12, 1986 | Debut July 7, 2006 (DODGEBALL 47) | Right-handed
✔
Participation Percentage
: 91 events = 70.5%
★
Notables
: 2x season finale headliner; 2x mid-season main eventer; 2x
Championship Chase
winner
[first-ever, most all-time]
★
Awards
: 2007 "Player of the Year" finalist; 2007 "Rivalry of the Year" finalist
[vs. K. Megill]
; 2006 "Light and Agile Dodger"
✔
Major Contributions
: wrote follow-up reports on dodgeball website; participated in
CREAMation 10
; brought food and drinks to various events
Ryan Letsche
Born May 7, 1985 | Debut November 26, 2005 (DODGEBALL 15) | Right-handed
✔
Participation Percentage
: 98 events = 60.8%
★
Notables
: 2x season finale headliner; 2x mid-season main eventer; 3x
Rimshot Contest
winner
[tied most all-time]
; 1x
Battle Royal
winner; 7th 2006
Captains Champion
★
Awards
: 2008 "Rivalry of the Year" finalist
[vs. G. Cornero]
; 2007 "Player of the Year" finalist; 2006 "Appreciation"
✔
Major Contributions
: innovator and creator of hanging team regeneration targets; innovator of
RiskBall
; co-innovator of
Wall vs. All
; participated in
CREAMations 5, 7, 9
; put together several musical soundtracks
In celebrating the importance of friendship and comradeship - the very same attributes that have kept this five-plus-year journey alive - the exclusive
ECDElite Family
wing saw its very first members, and they are - - -
The Winston Sisters
✔
Combined Participation
: 135 events
Valerie Winston
Born June 14, 1984 | Debut September 3, 2005 (DODGEBALL DAY 1) | Right-handed
★
Notables
: 3x anniversary event headliner
★
Awards
: 2006 "Allied Powers"
[with L. Freda]
; 2005 "Most Improved"
✔
Major Contributions
: participated in
CREAMation 1, 6
; helped set-up and decorate for major outings; arrived early to reserve courts
Lauren Winston
Born April 12, 1986 | Debut September 3, 2005 (DODGEBALL DAY 1) | Right-handed
★
Notables
: 1x mid-season main eventer, 3x anniversary event headliner
★
Awards
: 2006 "Appreciation" and "Most Improved"
✔
Major Contributions
: participated in
CREAMation 5
; helped set-up and decorate for major outings; arrived early to reserve courts; allowed use of her iPod for countless events
EastCoastDodgeball
once again applauds the unparalleled efforts put forth by these standout individuals. Their devotion helped construct a bright future for each and every
ECD
participant. If you unfortunately missed this special ceremony, feast your eyes on the terrific video below captured by one of the game's rising competitors, Joanice Lima.
Records and Recogntion
Attendance
: 26, comprised of 20 men and 6 women.
New Dodgeballers
: (3) Arthur Casbarro, Sa'Quan Gore, and Tim Lawrence.
Game Rules
: Classic two-team.
Featured Match
: Team WALL defeated Team ALL, 8 - 3, in the 11th contest between the two factions. Eleven total games is the most played for any Wall-All event. The series score is Wall 7, All 4.
Game-By-Game Results
: Wall 1, 2, 4-7, 9, 10; All 3, 8, 11
Soundtrack
: Justin Wolf
Theme Song
: "This Means War" by AC/DC
________________________________________
____________________________
Next Event
: "The Writer" always has something up his sleeve. Check back soon for the next play date!
body_html:
WALL vs. ALL 11: The Results
Personal rivalries, single-person showdowns, and bitter one-on-one animosity were violently kicked aside for EastCoastDodgeball's 2010 Thanksgiving "Fight Knight." At the forefront of the action comprised two deadly alliances each seething with nearly 24 months of pent-up frustration - the homeland WALL Knights and the daring ALL Army.

In this unprecedented 11th encounter, which faction would miraculously walk away unconquered?

MATCH SUMMARY
Upon arrival at the hallowed Wall High School battlegrounds, it was evident the ALL invaders had come properly prepared with heavy human weaponry and several surprise reinforcements. The mere sight of their starting five-man opposition had most of them chuckling before the initial weapon was even hurled! But it was the only laugh any of which would experience.

The 11th WALL Army was perhaps as fierce and nasty as any previous coalition assembled. Lead by veterans Fitzpatrick, Letsche, Basista, and Adams, this 8-person fortress humiliated the outnumbering ALL squad six out of the first seven vicious battles.

Catching machine and ECDElitist Mike "Sputz", the quick and agile Tronolone Brothers, as well as newly-inducted Elitist "Crazy One" Edwards fought valiantly to alter the tide of this shocking outcome. Every ounce of sweat and energy was drained from their systems from the experienced veterans to the less familiar, yet fearless combatants like Tim Lawrence, Kenny Jacobs, and Arthur Casbarro.

By the conclusion of 11 physically-taxing contests, the massive 11th ALL Army - all 18 strong - were handily sent retreating, forced to fight another day.

Team WALL defeated Team ALL, 8 - 3.

The Yearbook
Team ALL's 11th Army may have been the most diverse of any previous combination put together. Numerous high schools were represented: Allentown (DiBuccio), Estavam Ferri*** (Lima), Freehold Boro (Pham), Manasquan (Casbarro, Jacobs, Krott, Londono, Megill, Yochum), Monmouth Regional (Lawrence, J. Tronolone, M. Tronolone, Winston), Notre Dame* (Gore), Ocean Township (Edwards), Pennington (D'Luhy), Shore Regional (Moran), and West Springfield** (Hoppe)
*New school representation (Lawrenceville, New Jersey).
**Out-of-state representation (West Springfield, Virginia).
***First out-of-country school represented (Sao Jose, Sao Paulo, Brazil)

Online Exclusive!
WALL vs. ALL 11 became the second Wall-All clash to be held on Thanksgiving weekend, the first of which held in 2007.


On September 11, 2010, ECD fanatics witnessed the ribbon-cutting ceremony of the ECDElite Hall of Fame. That night, seven of the game's finest were respectfully honored in front of countless friends, family, and peers. Some three months later, the ECDElite halls reopened its doors to induct two more iconic figures, and they are - - -

Michael Edwards
Born March 12, 1986 | Debut July 7, 2006 (DODGEBALL 47) | Right-handed
✔ Participation Percentage: 91 events = 70.5%
★ Notables: 2x season finale headliner; 2x mid-season main eventer; 2x Championship Chase winner [first-ever, most all-time]
★ Awards: 2007 "Player of the Year" finalist; 2007 "Rivalry of the Year" finalist [vs. K. Megill]; 2006 "Light and Agile Dodger"
✔ Major Contributions: wrote follow-up reports on dodgeball website; participated in CREAMation 10; brought food and drinks to various events

Ryan Letsche
Born May 7, 1985 | Debut November 26, 2005 (DODGEBALL 15) | Right-handed
✔ Participation Percentage: 98 events = 60.8%
★ Notables: 2x season finale headliner; 2x mid-season main eventer; 3x Rimshot Contest winner [tied most all-time]; 1x Battle Royal winner; 7th 2006 Captains Champion
★ Awards: 2008 "Rivalry of the Year" finalist [vs. G. Cornero]; 2007 "Player of the Year" finalist; 2006 "Appreciation"
✔ Major Contributions: innovator and creator of hanging team regeneration targets; innovator of RiskBall; co-innovator of Wall vs. All; participated in CREAMations 5, 7, 9; put together several musical soundtracks

In celebrating the importance of friendship and comradeship - the very same attributes that have kept this five-plus-year journey alive - the exclusive ECDElite Family wing saw its very first members, and they are - - -

The Winston Sisters
✔ Combined Participation: 135 events
Valerie Winston
Born June 14, 1984 | Debut September 3, 2005 (DODGEBALL DAY 1) | Right-handed
★ Notables: 3x anniversary event headliner
★ Awards: 2006 "Allied Powers" [with L. Freda]; 2005 "Most Improved"
✔ Major Contributions: participated in CREAMation 1, 6; helped set-up and decorate for major outings; arrived early to reserve courts
Lauren Winston
Born April 12, 1986 | Debut September 3, 2005 (DODGEBALL DAY 1) | Right-handed
★ Notables: 1x mid-season main eventer, 3x anniversary event headliner
★ Awards: 2006 "Appreciation" and "Most Improved"
✔ Major Contributions: participated in CREAMation 5; helped set-up and decorate for major outings; arrived early to reserve courts; allowed use of her iPod for countless events

EastCoastDodgeball once again applauds the unparalleled efforts put forth by these standout individuals. Their devotion helped construct a bright future for each and every ECD participant. If you unfortunately missed this special ceremony, feast your eyes on the terrific video below captured by one of the game's rising competitors, Joanice Lima.


Records and Recogntion
Attendance: 26, comprised of 20 men and 6 women.
New Dodgeballers: (3) Arthur Casbarro, Sa'Quan Gore, and Tim Lawrence.

Game Rules: Classic two-team.
Featured Match: Team WALL defeated Team ALL, 8 - 3, in the 11th contest between the two factions. Eleven total games is the most played for any Wall-All event. The series score is Wall 7, All 4.
Game-By-Game Results: Wall 1, 2, 4-7, 9, 10; All 3, 8, 11

Soundtrack: Justin Wolf
Theme Song: "This Means War" by AC/DC

____________________________________________________________________

Next Event: "The Writer" always has something up his sleeve. Check back soon for the next play date!
